reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: JUST returned from holiday in st Lucia staying at St Lucian Rex following a recommadation from a friend.We chose all inclusive which was well worth it,as food was quite expensive in the resort.The service overall was very good and staff very friendly and helpful.The buffet restaurant had a different theme every night and the chefs made a great effort to cook lovely puddings and pastries. .We had a large room,very clean overlooking the pool and sea as did every room,and also a large balcolny There were two nice clean pools,but the pool furniture although functional,could do with an update. The location must be the best on the island,with banks,pubs,nightclubs and shops within 10 minutes easy walk away.Taxis very expensive but local buses cheap.I liked the ambiance of the hotel.I didnt like the mosquitoes-take your repellant.
reviews.title: 2 weeks of heaven

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Me and my wife went in the middle 2 weeks of September, all-inclusive and had a great time. We go on holiday to relax and have a great time. So, we head out with no intention of moaning and grumbling about small things, nor do expect food to taste like it does in the UK, or feel aggrieved when we can't get 99 channels on digital TV! I'm stressed enough in the UK with work etc. so a visit to the Caribbean is for one reason only - to enjoy it! It does what you expect and a bit extra. A great location and by all accounts the best beach on the island. Treat people well and they'll respond accordingly otherwise the staff may appear surly (as do a lot of the people in most of the W Indies - and the UK actually!). We only came across 1 miserable server and I've forgotten her name - young girl too which was a surprise, but virtually all of them great! The hotel could do with a bit of TLC for sure and the entertainment is at best good.
reviews.title: Does the job if you go on holiday to enjoy yourself

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: But, beach is excellent. Location if you want to explore a little is excellent. Food is very good. Rooms are good. St Lucia is excellent. 2 pools in the resort do the job. The "main pool" is quite small but enough for c40 people to relax around, close to the bars and there for a cooling dip. The larger pool is in what was the old Papillon Hotel (now part of the Rex) and has loads of room to relax, a swim up bar and a restaurant. Yes it needs a bit of maintenance (only a bit) but nothing that would put you off using it.
reviews.title: Great Location, Friendly Staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The beach is great and watersports are good - disappointed that there were no sunfish even tho advertised. But, everything else is fine. Some people on here complain they weren't around much - reason for that was the effects of 3 hurricanes in the area and 1 tropical depression. As a result for c10 of our 14 days the red flag was up and so it was deemed not safe to use the watersports. That said we still swam in the sea (like loads of others) and had great fun. Quite strange really - flat calm as you look out and then the swell appears and breaks in the 6-9 metres from the beach, but like I say, good fun.
reviews.title: ST lucien

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: So overall I'd rate it highly. We've been to lots of places (take a look at my map) and I would have no hesitation in visiting again - feel free to contact me if you've any questions. If you go have fun and do explore a little. The Pitons is a must - try the land and sea option which gives you more than just the catamaran (we did both), visit Gros Islet for the Friday night "jump up" - we went twice and it was a blast!!! Get out in the day and the evening as there's plenty on and plenty to see and do. Finally, take a trip onto Pigeon Island and climb the 2 peaks - it is a brilliant experience and some great views. My last point though, don't forget - you're on holiday to relax and have some fun, so chill out!
reviews.title: The Rex - it does what it says on the tin!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Having read the pre-Xmas reviews I was very concerned, especially about the water problems so I contacted Rex resorts and asked them to comment. I was re-assured that the hotel was back to normal so decided to go ahead with what was a much anticipated 1st visit to St Lucia over New Year.
reviews.title: I'm so glad I didn't cancel!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had a fantastic holiday and, with hindsight, realise how big a pinch of salt one needs when reading some of the reviews posted on Trip Advisor, especially by some of our friends from across the pond!!
reviews.title: Great location on a gorgeous beach, don't expect 5 star, you haven't paid for it!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The St Lucian is not a 5* resort but it doesn't pretend to be and we certainly didn't pay 5* prices. We thought it was fantastic value and it's position, right on the beach, is second to none. As written by a couple of recent reviewers, we also went all inclusive and found the food excellent and not at all repetitive. The staff are all very friendly and helpful, all you need to do is smile and be polite! Our room (great view looking out over the beach)was a little tired and could do with redecoration but everything worked. It was properly cleaned and serviced every day and there was absolutely no problems with bugs! The hurricane did a lot of damage to the island and the only way they're going to get back to normal is if their tourism income (something like 70% of GDP I believe) is maintained. I wouldn't hesitate to go back.
reviews.title: Amazing Location - Great Hotel!!
Don't believe everything you read
reviews.text: St Lucia is still recovering from the devastation of hurricane Tomas, and the people of this beautiful island have done a fantastic job of getting things back on track in an amazingly short time. With this in mind, we were fully prepared for things like water rationing etc, but still wanted our days in the sun before Christmas, so we chose to ignore the bad reviews and go anyway. Yes, the hotel is a little old, and they really struggled with flooding due to the amount of rain they are still having, but we had a lovely stay. The room was perfectly adequate, and the choices of food were great, something different every day. No, it wasn't 5 star food or service, but we hadn't paid for 5 star! All in all a great holiday in a beautiful spot right on the beach. My only disappointment was the town itself, Rodney Bay, which had been built purely for tourists and consisted of a small american style shopping mall, very little local flavour at all. There was very little in the way of nightlife, although we did go to the Friday Night jump up at Gros Islet, a reggae and rum party in the street, which was great fun. Definitely worth hiring a car or taking the bus to Castries to get a taste for the real St Lucia.

Oh, and take some earplugs, the walls are very thin and we were unfortunate to have some very inconsiderate neighbours who got up at 6 every day and made so much noise that they woke us, so we came home very tired from lack of sleep!
reviews.title: OMG It was a nightmare

reviews.text: We checked in on Friday October 29th. Room was okay, asked for 2nd floor, got 1st floor oceanfront. There are no dressers or drawers in room, so you had to put everything in the closet or leave in your suitcase.
reviews.title: Nightmare Hotel

reviews.text: The next day the hurricane hit. To make a very long story short: hotel did not have an operating generator (sister hotel next door did), no flashlights, no candles. We were left in the dark for 30 hours. Also we had no hot water, telephone. The food was terrible - they served us food that had been left in a warm refrigerator for 48 hours. They finally moved us over to the Royal, when we woke up there was 4" of water in the room. No one came to our room for 24 hours to get rid of the water. At this point it was starting to smell. We finally got out of there in 4 days and moved to the Bay Gardens (wonderful property).
reviews.title: Christmas in the Caribbean

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is so run down and neglected. Management has their hands tied, owners clearly don't want to spend any money on this place. The access to the beach was a 4 foot drop and beach chairs were locked up (we asked the front desk 4 times to unlock them). Also they wanted $100. deposit for a 2nd room key. The pool and fitness center was closed the whole time we were there.
reviews.title: Good Value, Great Location.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Do yourself a favor - please do not stay at this place. I read all the reviews and could not believe we were talking about the same place. I'm really not that picky about a room, I figure it's just to sleep, store your clothes and shower. But this place is just not acceptable to anyone standards.
reviews.title: Dont believe everything you read

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Well it's a funny thing for me to be abroad in the sun at Christmas. I went with my Mom & 17 year old son. The location was lovely. The accommodation was fine, clean no bugs, not top notch but not shabby either. I saw a hummingbird outside our balcony - amazing. The food was good, could feel a bit repetitive at times. Not brilliant for vegetarians, my Mom is vegetarian. Don't expect wonderful customer service from the staff it doesn't happen. BHowever, there was still a nice atmosphere in the resort.
reviews.title: Not for me
Great holiday
reviews.text: We stayed at the Rex in December 2010 for 10 days and having read recent reviews were a bit concerned at what we would find. However when we arrived we were really pleased. We were shown in to a slightly dated but really clean room that had excellent sea views. The recent water shortages, following the hurricane, had been resolved and we had water 24hrs a day that was always warm. The room could benifit from repainting but the location more than made up for it. The staff were really friendly and helpful. If you were friendly towards them they were great. We went all inclusive and the food and drinks were of a better standard than we have seen in many all inclusives. The food was good we ate in the restaraunts most of the time and really enjoyed it.. We normally get bored of the all inclusive food after a few days but the varied menu meant this was not the case. The main pool is really nice, cleaned daily and located just a few feet from the beach which is excellent. The sea was quite rough on some days but that just made the body boarding more fun the rest of the time it was great for swimming and snorkelling. The water sports were good the price was very reasonable and negotiable. We had a lesson on the hoby sail boat which only cost 25 US dollars after this we were able to take it out whenever we wanted as part of our all inclusive package. We met some great people many who go back year after year which says something. Our flight home was delayed for 4 days due to snow and the hotel again were really helpful. They let us stay in the same room for this period which meant we were able to enjoy an extended stay without disruption. If you are looking for 5 star luxury then you should book in somewhere else but I guess it will be double the cost. If you want a nice hotel with great views and a great location at a very good price then the Rex provided all that for us.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I needed a vacation and there was a mystery hotel being offered by Jetblue and we booked for 12/7-12/10 for St. Lucia. Well we got St Lucian by Rex Resorts. It took 2 hours by the shuttle bus up the hill to reach the hotel from the airport. We checked in and all the bad reviews that were posted about this hotel is true. The hotel is very old and the room we got was old too. The first sign is the room key, it's a regular standard key. The bathroom door was fixed so much that with the build up it would not close completely. There was no hairdryer in the room so I request one. I did not get it until the next day and it did not work!!! I couldn't use my curling iron because the plug would not fit into the socket and I did not have a converter. We had a king size bed and the duvet cover was dirty. We requested a change and they did change it within 1 hour. The air condition was not cool, so I did not have to use the duvet. A note was posted in the bathroom that there was a shortage of water due to the tropical storm. You would only get water from 9-6, so of course there was not hot water only lukewarm. Sometimes the water would be brown. The only good thing about the room was the ocean view. The beach was only 10 ft from the balcony. The beach was beautiful but the waves were rough. You have to be careful swiming in the ocean because there is no liefguard there. The hotel was empty so we have the beach to ourselves and it was very relaxing for us. The pool was dirty with sand, not worth swiming in it. Only 1 restaurant was opened, we had breakfast and went to get an omlete by the kitchen area. They cooked your eggs on a regular stove which was black, the coil around the opening was full of dust. The waitstaff was not friendly at all except for the bartender Harry. He served with smiles.I would recommend that you have your meals outside of this hotel. There is a shopping mall, a supermarket and several restaurants within 10 minutes walking. We had dinner at the Delirous Restaurnt. My husband had grilled chicken and I had Mahi Mahi, it was very good. Overall, I got a cheap deal for the room and the flight so it is what I paid. I would not return to this hotel but I would like to visit St. Lucia again because the beach was beautiful.
reviews.title: Not a 5 star hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I just returned from St. Lucia, first time to the island. It was beautiful, but still recovering from the Hurricane in November. We stayed at St. Lucian by Rex. It was very nice but dated. (The upgrade (Royal by Rex) next door looked nicer.) It was on the ocean, walk to all the bars, casino and restaurants, very safe. Our favorite spot was Spinnakers, on the beach, was a great bar to stop at. The resort food was good and the staff was great. It is a 3 star but we would stay here again. Due to the hurricane, hot showers are available 2 hours in the am and 2 hours in the pm. We ran out of hot water towards the end of the time allotted. Note not all rooms have hair dryers. Ours did not, we got one from Housekeeping but the plugs were no where near a mirrow. Hard to blow dry your hair. The area is about 1 ½ hour from the international airport to Rodney Bay. We used Winson Taxis (winsontaxiservice.com) both the drivers we used were knowledgeable about the area, it made the long trip fly by. My husband and I really enjoyed having them talk about the island and the welcome bottled water when they picked us up was really appreciated. It was our own private tour of the island. I would recommend their services to any one who wants, on time pick up, reasonable fee for service and polite, knowledgeable drives, in comfortable, clean taxis.
reviews.title: Would go back

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Friday, November 26, 2010: I was in a need of some rest and recuperation and I found what appeared to be an awesome trip on bookit.com. Bookit.com is a travel website I have used several times before and I never had a bad experience, however the pictures of the St Lucian by Rex Resorts, St. Lucia did not tell the true story. Over a month and half ago, St. Lucia was hit by Hurricane Tomas and the they are still recovering from the land slides and wind damage, but at this time the resorts are all up and operating. Upon arrival to the St Lucian by Rex Resorts, after traveling all day we were looking forward to a hot shower. upon check in I was told the resort was under a water restriction due to the hurricane and running water for showers, toilet flushing, hand washing, etc was ONLY available between the hours of 7am and 9am/5pm to 7pm = water was only available 4hours a day. Okay... I was a little upset by this however, it could be worse, there could be no water at all. I proceeded to check in and I final went to my room, to find there were two double beds and not the king size bed I requested, when I went to the front desk I was told there were no Papillon Rooms with a king size bed and if I wanted a king bed there would be a $65 US dollar up charge per night. I disagreed with this as I requested through bookit.com a king bed, after seeing a king size bed was available in the Papillon Room on the bookit.com website prior to booking my trip (I even called bookit.com and confirmed they received the request). I was told by the manager on duty, David, the travel agency did not relay the request and I found that extremely hard to believe, knowing I called and confirmed the request would be sent to the resort. After arguing with David, he told me that he would check the room inventory and see what he could do for me and I agreed this would be a suitable resolution. I returned to my room and when I did, I was greeted by the a strong mildew odor (I later discovered the room I was in was flooded by the hurricane), so I went for a drink - this is an all inclusive resort, so might as well have a drink. David found me at the bar and mentioned to me that there would be a room available for the me the following day with a king size bed it, and I thanked him for his efforts.
reviews.title: Beautiful island, nightmare resort

reviews.text: Saturday, November 27, 2010: I woke up extremely early to make sure I had plenty time to take a hot shower. FINALLY running water, I was able to flush the toilet, brush my teeth and shower (which took me 40minutes due to the lack of water pressure), however the morning was ruined when by boyfriend discovered a dead cock roach in the corner of the bathroom. We went to breakfast to find the food was mediocre at best and the staff miserably rude. We found something to eat and we found a spot by the pool to enjoy the St. Lucian sun, which battled it's way from the rain clouds. However if you wanted a drink with ice cubes in it, you had to wait until 12pm, as there was any ice on premies. OH...and you needed to hold your bladder movements as there was no water to flush the toilets or wash your hands, I hate to say this but why use the bathroom, when you could have peed in the pool, at least there was water in the pool. We ate lunch and dinner at the resort and again found the staff even more miserably rude and the best tasting food option were the vegetables at both meals. OH... and no one from the resort staff has informed my room with the king size bed was available for us to move into as promised by David. At least I had a genius idea, prior to the water being turned off, I filled the garage pails and the ice bucket with water, at least I could flush the toilet once the water was turned off.
reviews.title: What a great week!
